awd_titl_txt: Innovative Dependability Analysis Techniques in an          Advanced Design Environment
awd_abstract_narration: This research explores the relationships between models used to refine the system  design, to assess the real-time behavior of the system, and to assess the fault  tolerance.  these relationships are being combined to develop tools for system-  level modeling with dependability analysis of the design.  The approach builds  on two recently developed tools, ADEPT (Advanced Design Environment Prototype  Tool) and DREDD (Dependability and Risk Evaluation using Decision Diagrams).   Advanced techniques for dependability analysis of embedded computer systems are  being put into the ADEPT design environment.  There, a dynamic fault tree model  is automatically generated from the ADEPT system design model.  The fault tree  models uses a combination of Markov techniques, combinatorial approaches and  binary decision diagrams.  It can model permanent and transient hardware faults,  unrelated and related software, automatic recovery and reconfiguration  management, sequence dependencies and other dynamic behavior.
